Chapter on Contemplating the Heavens, Part 14, Section 11 on the Thirty-three Heavens
Next, the bhiká¹£us, knowing the fruits of karma, contemplate the abodes of the Thirty-three Heavens.
They see with their wisdom of hearing:
The Thirty-three Heavens have twenty-nine grounds, named Mandara.
What karma do sentient beings have to be born in this heaven?
They see with their wisdom of hearing:

There are good people who practice in accordance with the Dharma, with a sincere mind that does not trouble sentient beings, who truly see the fruits of karma, who purely uphold precepts and always delight in upholding precepts, and who are free from flattery.
Like refined true gold, they are pure and without defilements.
With right view, they practice and uphold good precepts, fearing the future world, and give to cultivate blessings.
This refers to seeing bhiká¹£us who cultivate meditation, wishing to sever the bonds of MÄra, sweating and feeling hot and thirsty in the heat of midsummer, giving them rock candy drinks or fans.

Such a good person does not kill living beings. If he sees hunters catching peacocks, mountain chickens, and various birds, and the hunters catching them, raising them, or killing them, or using the birds as playthings,
this person, seeing this, fears that they will be killed, ransoms the lives of these beings, releases them to their original places, and allows them to attain peace and happiness.
This is called not killing and benefiting sentient beings.
What is not stealing?
What is abandoning stealing?
Seeing the subtle fruits of karma, one gives rise to fear.

This person who upholds the precepts, whether on the banks of a river or a pond, or in other places, sees toothbrushes or honey water, for the sake of those who are practicing, this person, being thirsty, does not take or drink it, because of his compassionate mind.
This is called not stealing.
Such a person, upon the end of their life, is born in the Heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials.

Having been born in the heavens, all desires are fully endowed, with the sounds of the five kinds of music, playing in the gardens and forests, the wonderful sounds of various birds, the sounds of bees in the lotus flowers, and the sounds of wild geese.
In the forests, the trees are adorned with the seven treasures.
In the lotus ponds, the fragrant waters are filled like lapis lazuli, in which one plays.

In the mountain peaks, there are the flames and lights of the seven treasures, and caves of the seven treasures, with gold, silver, crystal, and indranÄ«la gems. Such various birds emit wonderful sounds.
Such birds have wings of the seven treasures, with which they are adorned, and their various sounds are heard with joyful pleasure.
All the heavenly multitudes follow each other in harmony, and countless beautiful sounds fill the gardens and forests.
In the forests, lovely food and drink flow from the rivers. When the gods see this, they give rise to great joy and exclaim that it is unprecedented.
In this way, the various colors and various adornments in the forest adorn their bodies.
Together with hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens, they play and enjoy pleasures, experiencing various heavenly delights.
Their bodies emit light, and their majestic virtue is unsurpassed.
In this way, the heavenly sons experience the karmic retribution of their actions, enjoying pleasures surrounded by celestial maidens, their minds filled with joy.
Having experienced pleasure, they think like this:
'I shall go to the forest surrounded by railings adorned with lapis lazuli jewels.

Adorned with various jewels, various birds emit wonderful sounds filling the forest. The minds of all the heavenly multitudes are filled with joy. With the sounds of the five musical instruments, they play and enjoy pleasures, playing in the forest with the heavenly multitudes and celestial maidens.
In the forest there is a pond called Clear Water, which is pure and lovely.
The heavenly multitudes play and enjoy pleasures in the lotus pond.

At that time, the newly born celestial son, together with the celestial maidens, wished to enter this forest. The other celestial beings saw from afar the celestial son singing, dancing, playing, and laughing, slowly walking towards them. They went to welcome the celestial son and went to the clear water pond. By the side of this pond, they joyfully enjoyed themselves and experienced pleasure.
By the power of the pond, everything that the celestial sons thought of would appear.
If they thought of color and fragrance, the bees would be complete.
If they thought of celestial drinks, the celestial drinks would appear.
If they thought of sugarcane, its color, aroma, and flavor would be complete in the same way. It was soft, pure, and clean, with a color like the full moon.

If they thought of forest trees, the most excellent and virtuous various kinds of trees and forests would appear. Netting of bells covered them, and when gently blown by the breeze, they emitted wonderful sounds like the sounds of gandharvas.
Furthermore, the celestial beings had this thought:
'We should enter the pond.'
Having had this thought, they immediately entered the pond and submerged their bodies deeply.

They saw in the pond various jeweled railings, adorned with jeweled palaces, either of true gold, white silver, vaiá¸Å«rya jewels, blue jewels, crystal, or various jewels for beds, covered with heavenly garments.
The heavenly sons and heavenly maidens played and enjoyed themselves in the pond, with countless varieties, never knowing enough, in the pleasures of the five desires.
There was no jealousy, and they loved and respected each other, playing, singing and dancing, enjoying themselves and experiencing pleasure.
Having emerged from the pond, they went to the Nandanavana forest, in which there were many birds, lotus ponds and groves, fully adorned.
Countless birds emitted wonderful sounds filling the forest. The trees always had various kinds of light. The forest was fully endowed with various merits, adorned with many lotus ponds.
The heavenly multitudes, their bodies with various kinds of light and merits, fully endowed with realms, experienced heavenly bliss.
The first pleasure of foolish ordinary beings is that of heavenly sons and heavenly maidens enjoying and experiencing pleasure together.
Foolish ordinary beings are bound by the net of celestial maidens, transmigrating through birth and death, mutually enjoying each other.

After enjoying pleasure for a long time, they again go to the palace on the peak of Mount MÅ«rdhÄna, ascending to the peak of Mount Sumeru, together with the heavenly maidens ascending the mountain peak.
A gentle breeze blows on their clothes, fluttering in the wind, all ascending together to the peak of Mount MÅ«rdhÄna.

At that time, the heavenly sons see this palace, extremely wonderful and marvelous, adorned with lotus flowers, the light of the seven treasures adorning the mountain peak, like the merits and virtues of the mountain fully corresponding.
The peak of Mount MÅ«rdhÄna is lofty and steep, extremely wonderful and marvelous, indescribable.
In this peak, they play, sing and dance, enjoying and experiencing pleasure.
After enjoying pleasure, they see a great light surpassing their original appearance.
In the mountain peaks, there was already light like sunlight, and then there was a strange light that shone on the mountain peaks, and after the light shone, it was a hundred thousand times brighter.
When the celestial beings saw it, they were amazed and had never seen such a thing before, so they immediately closed their two eyes and lowered their heads to stay.
Why is it so?
It is because they had never seen such light before.

The light shone on them for a short time and then disappeared, just like when sentient beings in JambudvÄ«pa see a heavenly fire descend, they all become greatly frightened. At that time, the celestial beings saw this light in the same way.
After being frightened for not a long time, their minds became peaceful again. After the fear had disappeared, they all discussed this matter together.
Why is there this rare phenomenon that causes us celestials to all become frightened, and then disappear in a short time?
At that time, the celestial beings, amazed at something they had never seen before, went to the SudharmÄ Hall and, together with the celestial maidens, went to where Åšakra was.
They saw Åšakra, Lord of the Devas, and bowed their heads in reverence and worship, all surrounding him respectfully.

At that time, the devas dwelling near Åšakra, Lord of the Devas, sang, danced, and played, adorned with various lotus flowers, joyfully laughing and playing. All the devas in front of Åšakra, Lord of the Devas, sang, danced, and played. The devas of the Maá¹‡á¸adhara Heaven neither sang nor danced, nor did they play or sing praises to Åšakra, Lord of the Devas, nor did they converse with the other devas.
At that time, Åšakra, Lord of the Devas, said to the devas dwelling in the Maá¹‡á¸adhara Heaven:
'Deva sons!

At that time, the devas dwelling in the Maá¹‡á¸adhara Heaven said to the Lord of the Devas:

At that time, the Lord of the Devas said to the devas dwelling in the Maá¹‡á¸adhara Heaven:
'What rare and extraordinary things have you seen that you say you have never seen or heard of before?'ğŸ”½Then the Manjushri's Magical Manifestation Net
the gods of Manjushri's Magical Manifestation Net addressed Indra, saying:
'Heavenly King!
While we were playing on the peak of Mount Mandara, ascending that mountain, we saw a great light descending from above, and all the mountain peaks were greatly ablaze.
We saw this and thought it strange and unprecedented.
We do not yet know what kind of causes and conditions this will bring.'
Indra, having heard this, contemplated for a moment and told the heavenly multitudes:
'There is such a thing!
I have already heard of such a matter before.
When I heard this matter at that time, I immediately asked the World-Honored One:
For what causes and conditions is there this extraordinary and rare event?
At that time, the World-Honored One told me:
Kausika!
You have already closed the door to the evil paths, do not be afraid.
All conditioned things are included in birth and death, which is called impermanence.
Now listen attentively, and I will explain it to you.
This is the end of the life of the devas in the Heaven of YÄma.

The devas in the Heaven of YÄma are superior to the devas in the Heaven of the Thirty-three in terms of their physical appearance, form, and enjoyment of pleasures by a hundred thousand times. However, due to the exhaustion of their karma, they will die and fall back. They will fall from above, a distance of countless hundreds of thousands of yojanas.

The light of the devas in the Heaven of YÄma is something the devas in the Heaven of the Thirty-three cannot look at.
Why is it so?
Because it is not their realm.

The celestial beings of the Heaven of YÄma are due to three kinds of karma, while the Thirty-three Celestials only speak of two kinds of karma.
I heard the World-Honored One say this, and what you see now is also like this. Now I will tell you.
When the celestial beings heard these words, they gave rise to a mind of detachment from the five desires.
This is the time when the celestial beings of the Heaven of YÄma are about to die and fall, the sign of their demise.
The light goes away from here for countless hundreds of thousands of yojanas, and then descends from the sky. Do not be afraid.
At that time, Åšakra, King of the Devas, spoke a verse to the celestial beings, saying:
In accordance with such great joy, the wealth and bliss are also like this,
But one will definitely fall and experience such great suffering.
The World-Honored One says that karma obtains similar fruits,
Because the karma is superior, the fruits are also like this.
The Dharma of upper and upper continuity is obtained according to one's karma;
Its fruits are also like this.ğŸ”½This majestic power is supreme,
Knowing that karma is definitely superior;ğŸ”½Because karma is supreme,
One attains supreme life, form, and strength.
All the heavenly multitudes, due to the exhaustion of karma, return and regress,
Like burnt and spoiled seeds, planted but not growing again.ğŸ”½Contemplate the continuity of the mind's nature,
Moment after moment like a lamp flame,ğŸ”½The mind's causes cease moment by moment,
And so do all karmic actions.
Because impermanent karmic causes will eventually be destroyed,ğŸ”½That is to say, those who seek constant pleasure,
This is unobtainable,
If pleasure is not impermanent, it does not arise or cease.ğŸ”½If there is a wise one,
One should leave the realm of desire,ğŸ”½One who is disgusted with and detached from desire,
Will attain the pleasure of leaving desire.
All contaminated dharmas are impermanent, suffering, and unreal;
If one attains the uncontaminated dharmas, then it is called immovable bliss.'

'You devas should never be negligent at any time.'

At that time, the devas pay homage to Åšakra, Lord of the Devas, and return to their abodes. Having reached their original realms, they experience the pleasures of the five desires, the sounds of the five kinds of music, and various adornments in the gardens and forests, experiencing the pleasures of the devas.

Until their good karmic actions are exhausted, they will die and fall back, following their karmic actions to transmigrate, falling into the hells, the realm of hungry ghosts, or the realm of animals.

If they are born among humans, they will be born in a place of comfort and ease, or become great people who are loved by all, without illness or affliction, born into a great clan or the family of a great elder, always experiencing comfort and ease until old age and death.
This is due to their remaining karmic actions.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and observe the abodes of the Thirty-three Celestials.
They see with their wisdom of hearing:
The Thirty-third place of the Thirty-three Celestials is called Upper Realm.
What karma do sentient beings have to be born in this heaven?
They see with their wisdom of hearing:
There are sentient beings who practice in accordance with the Dharma, believe in the fruits of karma, practice right views, give in order to cultivate blessings, and uphold a portion of the precepts.
First they uphold most of them, and later they uphold all of them.
They give boots and shoes and alms bowls to monks who travel on the road.
They do not kill or steal.
There may be barbarians in the borderlands who capture people and want to kill them, but these precept-keepers rescue and redeem them.
If they are kings, they may see wealth obtained through conquest in the wilderness, but fearing to violate theft, they do not accept their share.
This is called not stealing.
What is meant by not killing?
This person who upholds the precepts, whether a king or not, sees evil people who want to harm him, but because he upholds the precepts, he does not take their lives.
Such a person fears the retribution of karma. When their life ends, they are born in the Heaven of the Thirty-three, in the place called Upper Realm.

Having been born in this heaven, due to their good karma, three thousand celestial maidens serve them. The celestial maidens adorn their bodies with various necklaces and hold various musical instruments such as lutes and harps, as well as various fragrances. They sing various songs and praise the celestial being, wishing to draw near to him with thoughts of desire.
When the celestial being sees them, he also feels joy towards the celestial maidens and they all go together to the Constant Joy Garden.
The forest is adorned with vaiá¸Å«rya jewels, gold, and silver trees, and various streams, lotus groves, and ponds adorn the garden.
There are innumerable rivers adorning it, and nets of various bells cover it above. Innumerable birds adorn it all around, emitting innumerable kinds of beautiful and harmonious sounds.
The forest is adorned in this way. The gods and goddesses in the garden and forest reflect each other, becoming even more wonderful.

In the forest there is a mountain called Playful, made of the seven treasures. There are innumerable kinds of beautiful jeweled deer, with red lotus jewels for their flanks, true gold for their backs, white silver for their bellies, true gold for their heads, coral for their feet, and crystal for their horns.
Some have one color, namely golden color, and some have two colors - golden color and silver color. All kinds of colors adorn them.
All the deer follow the gods among the forests and trees, emitting various wonderful sounds like the singing of heavenly maidens. The deer sing in this way with various wonderful sounds.
After these heavenly beings have experienced such immeasurable pleasures, they go to the peak of Mount Sumeru, where there is a great river called Mountain Valley.

Riding various palaces, with the sounds of the five kinds of music from various instruments, endowed with the best desires, supremely joyful, and fully majestic, they go to the river in the mountain valley on the peak of Mount Sumeru.
Between the various river banks, they play and enjoy themselves.

On the banks of the flowing waters, in the lotus groves, and in the gardens, the sounds of singing are delightful to the ears, and they experience the pleasures of desire, all giving rise to joy and mutual respect.
There are many heavenly beings and celestial maidens, whose bodies are anointed with flowers and fragrances, and flower garlands draped over their heads.
Due to their good karma, they experience heavenly bliss, and by the power of their karma, they follow and play.
The pleasures they experience as gods are beyond analogy, but now a small portion is described, and all worldly people cannot fully describe them.
Why is this?
It is because this heavenly pleasure is incomparable and has no equivalent.
Because of the causes of good karma of observing precepts among humans, one experiences such pleasures.

In this heaven, one experiences the pleasures of the five desires until the delightful good karma is destroyed and exhausted, one's life ends and one falls back, following karma to transmigrate and fall into hell, hungry ghosts, or animals.

If reborn among humans, one has the utmost happiness, is close to mountains and marshes, has many rivers and forests in the country, and becomes either a great king or a great minister with the utmost authority.
This is due to remaining karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate the abodes of the Thirty-three Celestials.
They see with their wisdom of hearing:
The Thirty-third Ground of the Thirty-three Celestials is called Majestic Countenance.
What karma do sentient beings have to be born in that heaven?
They see with their wisdom of hearing:

There are sentient beings with the utmost pure mind, who give, cultivate blessings, uphold the seven kinds of precepts, do not associate with bad friends, uphold the precepts without impurity, protect and uphold blessings and virtues, always diligently make progress, with a single-minded and upright mind, like refining true gold.
How many kinds of precepts are upheld?
Namely, not killing and not stealing.
What is meant by not killing?

If the country is in chaos and people kill each other, this precept-upholding person, fearing to break the precepts, would rather give up their own life than harm others, and does not instruct others to kill. This is called not killing living beings.
What is meant by not stealing?
If the country is in chaos and everyone competes to take others' things, this precept-upholding person, fearing to break the precepts, would rather starve to death than take others' things.
What is meant by giving?
To whom should blessings be given?
If one makes offerings to the Buddha or gives to the place where the Dharma is being taught.
First, cultivate the mind, with a correct view.
When this person's life ends, they are reborn in the heaven of majestic countenance.
Having been born in this heaven, their majestic radiance and light encircle them, with the most excellent color.
They experience similar karmic results, due to their wholesome actions.
The sounds of the five types of music delight their ears;
They always smell the fragrances of mandÄra flowers, kuÅ›a grass, blue lotus flowers, and seven-jeweled flowers, which delight their noses;
Their tongues experience various supreme heavenly flavors;
Their eyes see various colors of the most excellent mountains and valleys made of the seven treasures;
Their bodies obtain various supreme heavenly garments, without warp or weft;
The fragrance of utpala flowers is used to anoint their bodies.
In this way, due to the wholesome actions of this celestial son, the fruits of goodness are accomplished.
Surrounded by a retinue of a thousand celestial maidens, the adorned garden and forest are as excellent and sublime as if they were made of molten gold.

Hanging from the golden and silver branches are jeweled bells, which emit wonderful sounds when gently stirred by the breeze, providing entertainment. One also hears various songs and praises, experiencing the utmost bliss.
Adorned with heavenly garlands and heavenly garments, one frolics in the valleys, beholding countless various colors of lapis lazuli, gold, silver, green jewels, and great blue king jewels.
On the peaks of crystal mountains, one sees one's own body, like a clear mirror.
At that time, the newly born celestial being, surrounded by celestial maidens, enters the jeweled mountain peaks, sees hundreds of thousands of bodies, and is a hundred times more joyful.
The celestial maidens are also overjoyed and exclaim:
My body is so upright and adorned!
I now constantly enjoy the sounds of the five kinds of music and experience the blissful rewards of the five heavenly desires.
The celestial maidens, their minds filled with joy, will go from one mountain peak to another, from one mountain valley to another, all the while enjoying themselves and indulging in pleasures.
Addicted to the poison of desire, their minds intoxicated like those with a fever, their actions are improper. The celestial beings, destroyed by heedlessness, are also like this.

Together with the celestial maidens, they will play on the mountain peaks, enjoying various foods and drinks, the flavors of sudhÄ, and the songs of various birds. They will experience immeasurable pleasures in the gardens and forests.
They will love each other, play together with a single mind, and be mindful of each other.
Thus, they will play, adorned with celestial garments, flower garlands, and necklaces. They will all go together to the Wish-Fulfilling Garden or to the river, lake, and pond of wine.

In this river, red utpala flowers will cover its surface, and it will be adorned with geese, ducks, and mandarin ducks.ğŸ”½Here, the celestial beings will play with the celestial maidens, their minds intoxicated by the poison of desire.
At that time, the heavenly multitudes, on the riverbank, ate the flower juices, or drank the supreme flavors of heavenly delicious drinks, playing and enjoying themselves with the heavenly birds.
Seeing it, the eyes are delighted.
At that time, the heavenly beings, intoxicated by the poison of love, drank heavenly wine, which increased a hundredfold.
The fire of love burns the firewood of the five desires, and being thirsty with desire, they are not content, all bound by the net of desire.
It is like a person who violates the laws of the state and is bound by the king.
All the heavenly multitudes see countless hundreds of thousands of desires, seeing them they go there and play within them.
Having already played on the drinking riverbank, in the river, lotus flowers, red lotuses, blue lotuses, and jasmine flowers, the birds are in them, joyfully enjoying themselves.
In the pond there are birds called red water, with bodies and wings made of the seven treasures, their bodies shining with light.
Seeing the celestial beings indulging in pleasures and being negligent, he spoke a verse to the celestial sons, saying:
The celestial beings are always negligent, and the celestial birds are also like this.
The celestial beings and flying birds, they are neither superior nor inferior to each other.
Delighting in practicing unrighteousness, not seeking the bliss of liberation,
If the celestial beings are like this, they are no different from the birds.
If one is free from negligence, in accordance with the Dharma, practicing and cultivating,
Then one will be superior in the world, because of being diligent and not negligent.
If the celestial beings delight in playing, the birds are also like this.
The celestial beings are then equal to the birds, without any difference.
Because of the superiority of their karma, their way of rebirth is also superior.
If one enters into evil dharmas, one cannot be reborn in a good place.
If one does not realize that birth and death are all impermanent,
If the heavenly beings are like this, they are foolish like animals.
The suffering of birth, the suffering of old age, and the suffering of death are also like this.
Affection and separation, one after another, one experiences various sufferings.
If a person has wisdom and views the taintless Dharma,
He is superior in the world, not you who indulges in negligence.
If a person awakens to suffering and gives rise to pure wisdom,
That person is called a heavenly being, not you who is attached to desires.
Relatives and brothers, again and again loving separation,
If one is not disgusted with birth and death, it is no different from a bird.
Although the fault of drinking alcohol is grave, one can still sober up from being drunk,
But one cannot awaken from negligence, therefore one should stay far away from it.
Negligence destroys people, causing them to revolve in the five realms,
Therefore, leaving negligence is the foremost supreme method.
Drunkenness on alcohol lasts only a day, causing people to lose consciousness;
The intoxication of heedlessness causes people to wander through hundreds of thousands of eons.
If one departs from heedlessness, one will attain a state of non-extinction;
If a person delights in heedlessness, they will always experience birth and death.
If a person seeks benefit, they should abandon heedlessness;
The Great Sage has said that heedlessness gives rise to afflictions.
Birds engage in heedlessness due to the light-mindedness of animals;
Why do the gods engage in heedlessness and are unable to abandon it?
' In this way, the celestial birds, due to their wholesome karma, teach and benefit all the gods.
These celestial birds are like parents, benefiting and instructing them.
However, due to their heedless minds, the celestial beings are unaware of the beneficial Dharma taught by the celestial birds.
At that time, the gods again went to the forest of Madhu.
The various sounds of the heavenly beings are mutually loving and respectful, and they go to the MadhurÄ forest to play and enjoy themselves.
The forest is all made of trees of the seven treasures, with branches and leaves connecting to each other. Countless bees play on the heavenly jeweled flowers on the forest trees.
When the heavenly beings see this, they all give rise to joy and play, sing, and dance with the heavenly maidens.
The singing voices of the heavenly maidens pervade the garden and forest. Sounds from the garden and forest are all like singing voices.
The sounds of birds and bees are equal in sound and pervade Mount Sumeru.
The original nature of Mount Sumeru is already lovable, and with these sounds, it becomes twice as excellent.
When the heavenly beings see or hear this, they all experience happiness and great desire is fulfilled.

Together with the celestial maidens, they play and enjoy pleasures, adorned in various ways, with perfect beauty, playing, singing and dancing, experiencing heavenly pleasures, until their good karma is exhausted, their lives end, and they fall back, following their karma, transmigrating and falling into hell, the realm of hungry ghosts, or the animal realm.
If they have remaining good karma and are reborn among humans, they will experience the utmost happiness.
Their minds are always joyful, their facial features are upright, and they are loved and respected by all people, sometimes becoming kings or ministers.
This is due to their remaining karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and observe the abodes of the Thirty-three Celestials.
They see with their wisdom of hearing:
There is a heavenly realm in the thirty-second heaven called Flaming Wheel of Awesome Virtue.
What karma do sentient beings have that causes them to be born there?
They see with their wisdom of hearing:

These sentient beings cultivate merit with a wholesome mind, without flattery or deception, observe the true Dharma, and benefit all sentient beings with a mind of right view, believing in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saá¹ƒgha.
Their minds are gentle, and they practice meritorious deeds.
If they see a temple or a Buddha stÅ«pa that is damaged, they repair it.
If a stÅ«pa or temple is on fire, they exhaust their strength to save it, not sparing their own lives.
If they see a great fire burning the precious treasures, wealth, and goods of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saá¹ƒgha, they risk their lives to save it.
If they see someone being burned by fire, they enter the fire to save them.
Out of a compassionate mind, they are able to perform such difficult meritorious deeds.
How do they refrain from killing and stealing?
If they see something lost on the side of the roadâ€”whether gold, silver, or other valuablesâ€”they pick it up and announce:
Whose belongings are these?
If someone claims, These are my belongings, they should ask about the details. If it is true, they should return it.
If no one claims it, keep it for seven days, proclaiming it daily. If no owner claims it, give this treasure to the king, ministers, state and county officials.
If the king, ministers, state and county officials see a meritorious person not taking this object, they should later give it to the Buddha, Dharma and Sangha.
This is called not stealing.
What is meant by not killing?
If walking on a road and seeing insects, ants, earthworms, moths, frogs and other small creatures, avoid them and walk on a distant path.
With a compassionate mind, protect sentient beings, believe in the fruits of karma, know the faults of birth and death, and observe the dharma of arising and ceasing.
This is called not killing.

When the body of this person who upholds the precepts perishes and their life ends, they are born in a good realm, in the place where the wheel of majestic flames resides in the Heaven of the Thirty-three.

Having been born in that heaven, the foremost good karma is that the wheel of majestic virtue surrounds and adorns it, and one experiences bliss that cannot be fully described. Now a small portion is explained.
Their bodies are all-pervading, their majestic virtue and radiance shining like the sun, but not dazzling the eyes, due to their good karma.
Hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens surround this person and experience bliss. Their palaces are made of gold, beryl, and sapphire, and they play, sing, and dance.
There are also gardens and forests where flowers always bloom, and many birds sing melodious sounds. Seeing the colors and hearing the sounds are all delightful.
There is also a forest called Opening and Closing, where in all the forests, whether one's eyes are open or closed, one always sees light.
In this forest, one plays and experiences bliss with celestial maidens, giving rise to a sense of wonder.
One then goes to the forest of Jita, where with countless hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens, one sings, dances, and plays on mountain peaks.
Due to the singing, various sounds emerge, just like the sounds of singing.
If there are other celestials who are playing and experiencing bliss in the forests, upon hearing this singing, they will leave the forest and say to each other:
'What kind of sound is this?
It is like a second Åšakra DevÄnÄm-Indra.'
Having emerged, he immediately saw the newly born god. The heavenly beings saw him and joyfully welcomed the god, giving rise to a rare state of mind.
Having seen the god, they all rejoiced and said to the god,
'Welcome, god!
